metadata.Title: CVE-2023-1999 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
There exists a use after free/double free in libwebp. An attacker can use the ApplyFiltersAndEncode() function and loop through to free best.bw and assign best = trial pointer. The second loop will then return 0 because of an Out of memory error in VP8 encoder, the pointer is still assigned to trial and the AddressSanitizer will attempt a double free.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1999` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 112.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 112.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 112.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

libwebp6 - 0.6.1-2ubuntu0.18.04.2
libwebpdemux2 - 0.6.1-2ubuntu0.18.04.2
libwebpmux3 - 0.6.1-2ubuntu0.18.04.2
webp - 0.6.1-2ubuntu0.18.04.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '112.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
libwebp package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.6.1-2ubuntu0.18.04.2').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
